trial_identification.studytitle: Antares Coronary Stent System to Facilitate Side Branch Interventions
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Treatment sucess with the Antares Stent System for Coronary Artery Stenting at or near a Major Sidebranch

interventions.interventions: Coronary Stenting involves placing a metal mesh in a blood vessel in the heart to open a blockage. The stent is inserted through a blood vessel in the arm or leg and is put in place by inflating a balloon inside the stent. The stent cannot be removed from the blood vessel once it is in place.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Bifurcation Treatment Success- assessed by a visual assessment blood flow and stenosis in both the main vessel and side branch.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at the conclusion of the bifurcation procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Major cardiac adverse events including cardiac death, myocardial infarction and Target Lesion Revascularization as determined by clinician observation.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 1 month, 6 months, and 12 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sidebranch Access Success - an evaluation of the ability to access the sidebranch with wire, balloon, and/or stent, to perform sidebranch interventions following Antares stent placement in the main vessel
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Determined at the conclusion of the bifurcation procedure

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: symptomatic or documented myocardial ischemia, study lesion is a single bifurcation lesion that has not been previously treated, By angiograpic review the study lesion has a diameter and length appropriate for Antares Stent,
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Acute myocardial infarction, Shock, Stroke, Coagulopathy, Left main coronary lesion, Total occlusion, Diffuse disease, thrombus or severe calcification, Previous Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) surgery,

recruitment.withdrawnreasonother: Company decided to re-design device with a drug-coating

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 7060 Koll Center Parkway Suite 300 Pleasanton, CA 94566

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 7060 Koll Center Parkway Suite 300 Pleasanton, CA 94566

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study to evalute the use of the Antares Stent System in patients with coronary disease at a location where two vessels are meeting.
